name: ListRecentCodeScanningAnalyses
description:
Retrieve recent code scanning analyses for a repository.

Use this tool to list the details of recent code scanning analyses for a GitHub repository. It retrieves a paginated list starting with the most recent analyses. Useful for understanding security events and code quality checks. Requires proper access tokens or GitHub App permissions for private repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive, and it should match the GitHub account owning the target repository.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: code_scanning_tool_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of a code scanning tool to list results by this tool only. Cannot be used with `tool_guid`.

value_schema.description: The name of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_name` or `tool_guid`, but not both.

parameters.name: code_scanning_tool_guid
parameters.description: The GUID of the code scanning tool to filter results. Specify either this or 'tool_name', not both.

value_schema.description: The GUID of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. Note that some code scanning tools may not include a GUID in their analysis data. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_guid` or `tool_name`, but not both.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the results to fetch. Used for paginating through the list of analyses.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page, with a maximum limit of 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: git_reference_for_analyses
parameters.description: The Git reference for analyses; format as `refs/heads/<branch>` for branches or `refs/pull/<number>/merge` for pull requests.

value_schema.description: The Git reference for the analyses you want to list. The `ref` for a branch can be formatted either as `refs/heads/<branch name>` or simply `<branch name>`. To reference a pull request use `refs/pull/<number>/merge`.

parameters.name: filter_by_sarif_id
parameters.description: Filter analyses that belong to a specific SARIF upload by providing the SARIF ID.

value_schema.description: Filter analyses belonging to the same SARIF upload.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: The order to sort results, either ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: sort_by_property
parameters.description: Specify the property for sorting the results. Available option: 'created'.

value_schema.description: The property by which to sort the results.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: tool_name
parameters.description: The name of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_name` or `tool_guid`, but not both.

value_schema.description: The name of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_name` or `tool_guid`, but not both.

parameters.name: tool_guid
parameters.description: The GUID of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. Note that some code scanning tools may not include a GUID in their analysis data. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_guid` or `tool_name`, but not both.

value_schema.description: The GUID of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. Note that some code scanning tools may not include a GUID in their analysis data. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_guid` or `tool_name`, but not both.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The Git reference for the analyses you want to list. The `ref` for a branch can be formatted either as `refs/heads/<branch name>` or simply `<branch name>`. To reference a pull request use `refs/pull/<number>/merge`.

value_schema.description: The Git reference for the analyses you want to list. The `ref` for a branch can be formatted either as `refs/heads/<branch name>` or simply `<branch name>`. To reference a pull request use `refs/pull/<number>/merge`.

parameters.name: sarif_id
parameters.description: Filter analyses belonging to the same SARIF upload.

value_schema.description: Filter analyses belonging to the same SARIF upload.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort the results by.

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The property by which to sort the results.

value_schema.description: The property by which to sort the results.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
